comment.author: 26650236@N07
comment._content: In 1894, the fleet was enlarged by the addition of the Geneva Cross, another purpose-built paddle-steamer. She was 143 feet long, 22 feet wide, and with a draught of 5 feet. In her stern she had an upper cabin for 16 acute patients in two compartments, and a lower cabin for 36 patients in two compartments. There was a fore cabin for carrying visitors
